name: UPawnSensingComponent
doc:
SensingComponent encapsulates sensory (ie sight and hearing) settings and functionality for an Actor,
allowing the actor to see/hear Pawns in the world. It does nothing on network clients.

HearingThreshold: Max distance at which a makenoise(1.0) loudness sound can be heard, regardless of occlusion
LOSHearingThreshold: Max distance at which a makenoise(1.0) loudness sound can be heard if unoccluded (LOSHearingThreshold should be > HearingThreshold)
HearingMaxSoundAge: Max age of sounds we can hear. Should be greater than SensingInterval, or you might miss hearing some sounds!
OnSeePawn: Delegate to execute when we see a Pawn.
OnHearNoise: Delegate to execute when we hear a noise from a Pawn's PawnNoiseEmitterComponent.
SensingInterval: Amount of time between pawn sensing updates. Use SetSensingInterval() to adjust this at runtime. A value <= 0 prevents any updates.
bEnableSensingUpdates: If true, component will perform sensing updates. At runtime change this using SetSensingUpdatesEnabled().
bOnlySensePlayers: If true, will only sense player-controlled pawns in the world. Default: true
bSeePawns: If true, we will perform visibility tests and will trigger notifications when a Pawn is visible. Default: true
bHearNoises:
If true, we will perform audibility tests and will be notified when a Pawn makes a noise that can be heard. Default: true
IMPORTANT NOTE: If we can see pawns (bSeePawns is true), and the pawn is visible, noise notifications are not triggered.

methods.name: SetPeripheralVisionAngle
methods.doc: Sets PeripheralVisionAngle. Calculates PeripheralVisionCosine from PeripheralVisionAngle

methods.name: SetSensingInterval
methods.doc:
Changes the SensingInterval.
If we are currently waiting for an interval, this can either extend or shorten that interval.
A value <= 0 prevents any updates.

methods.name: SetSensingUpdatesEnabled
methods.doc: Enables or disables sensing updates. The timer is reset in either case.
